page.title: 01EAST GRINSTEAD ENVIRNONMENT
page.content: The town stands on the northern edge of the High Weald Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. It includes the 600000 acres of Ashdown Forest and Weir Wood Reservoir, a wildfowl habitat now protected as a Scientific Site of Special Importance. Accordingly the West Sussex County policy is to preserve the countryside and limit new development . Although tourism accounts for growing numbers of visitors their accommodation may be provided only by conversion of existing buildings. With 57% of houses in the area being sold to newcomers, there is a danger that the character of the town will change and the Countryside Code be ignored. Constant vigilance by local amenity groups is necessary to protect the surrounding villages from expansion.
